name: tckresample
description:
Resample each streamline in a track file to a new set of vertices.

It is necessary to specify precisely ONE of the command-line options for controlling how this resampling takes place; this may be either increasing or decreasing the number of samples along each streamline, or may involve changing the positions of the samples according to some specified trajectory.

Note that because the length of a streamline is calculated based on the sums of distances between adjacent vertices, resampling a streamline to a new set of vertices will typically change the quantified length of that streamline; the magnitude of the difference will typically depend on the discrepancy in the number of vertices, with less vertices leading to a shorter length (due to taking chordal lengths of curved trajectories).

References:
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au) and J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com)

inputs.name: in_tracks
inputs.description: the input track file

inputs.name: out_tracks
inputs.description: the output resampled tracks

inputs.name: upsample
inputs.description: increase the density of points along the length of each streamline by some factor (may improve mapping streamlines to ROIs, and/or visualisation)

inputs.name: downsample
inputs.description: increase the density of points along the length of each streamline by some factor (decreases required storage space)

inputs.name: step_size
inputs.description: re-sample the streamlines to a desired step size (in mm)

inputs.name: num_points
inputs.description: re-sample each streamline to a fixed number of points

inputs.name: endpoints
inputs.description: only output the two endpoints of each streamline

inputs.name: line
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a line between 'start' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

type.name: line
type.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a line between 'start' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: num
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a line between 'start' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a line between 'start' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: end
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a line between 'start' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: arc
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

type.name: arc
type.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: num
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: start
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: mid
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: end
inputs.description: resample tracks at 'num' equidistant locations along a circular arc specified by points 'start', 'mid' and 'end' (specified as comma-separated 3-vectors in scanner coordinates)

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.
